page.title: 18SCHOOLS: King James's
page.content: "The Royal Free Gramar Schole in Almonbry" was given its{charter}in {1608.}It is beautifully decorated and has the{Great Seal}fastened to it. The charter was found recently and returned to the school. Life was hard for the scholars in the old days. The school day was from {7 until 5}and there were lessons in {Latin and Greek.}The statutes said there was to be{"no swearing, cursing, {lying, strife or any rude or immodest {behaviour."}Punishments included being beaten with birchwood. Names could go in the{"Black Bill"}and the final punishment was expulsion. The school is now a{comprehensive with over{600 pupils.}The "olde schole house" is still used along with new buildings. On{Founder's Day,}old and new{Almondburians}walk up the hill to the church for a special service.
